alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson; Monroe (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 9:13PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Clark, Jackson and northern Monroe Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 913 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Greenwood to near Humbird to 7 miles south of Osseo. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Neillsville around 930 PM CDT. Shortville around 935 PM CDT. Hatfield around 945 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Franklin, Ballard Road And Pray Avenue, City Point, Wildcat Mound, Melrose, Shamrock, The Black River Correctional Center, Pigeon Creek Campground, York and Potters Flowage. This includes Interstate 94 between mile markers 92 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
